Field Detail

READ_PROP_FILE_TO_MAP

public static final com.google.common.base.Function<java.lang.String,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> READ_PROP_FILE_TO_MAP
Function to transform from a file path to a property map based on the contents. The map returned from the function is immutable.

See Also:
loadPropertiesFile(String)
Method Detail

resolvePropertiesInternally

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> resolvePropertiesInternally(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> unresolvedProperties)
Resolves properties found in values that are defined as keys in the map. The input map is unchanged.

Parameters:
unresolvedProperties - a map of properties
Returns:
an immutable copy of the input where values have nested properties resolved

resolvePropertiesExternally

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> resolvePropertiesExternally(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> unresolvedProperties,
                                                                                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> context)
Resolves properties found in values that are defined as keys in another map. The input maps are unchanged. Consider resolving properties internally before or after doing this, depending on the intended priority ordering.

Parameters:
unresolvedProperties - a map of properties including some that need to be resolved
context - a map of properties from which to resolve property references
Returns:
an immutable copy of the input where values have nested properties resolved

getSystemPropertyStrings

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getSystemPropertyStrings()
Gets a live view over the entries in the current system properties map that map a String key to a String value. This will typically be everything, but typed more usefully than a Hashtable<Object, Object>.

Consider copying the result with ImmutableMap.copyOf(Map) in order to avoid the extra performance penalty on each lookup.

Returns:
view of the String entries in the system property map

getStringEntries

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getStringEntries(java.util.Map<?,?> map)
Gets a live view over the entries in the specified map that map a String key to a String value.

Consider copying the result with ImmutableMap.copyOf(Map) in order to avoid the extra performance penalty on each lookup.

Parameters:
map - over which to provide a view
Returns:
view of the String entries in the map

loadPropertiesFile

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> loadPropertiesFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                                                                           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                                                  java.io.IOException,
                                                                                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Loads a properties file into a map, returning a immutable view.

Parameters:
fileName - name of the file to parse
Returns:
ImmutableMap of properties found in the file
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file did not exist
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem reading the file
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file was malformed and could not be parsed

                                                                                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

Parameters:
file - file to parse
Returns:
ImmutableMap of properties found in the file
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file did not exist
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem reading the file
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file was malformed and could not be parsed

loadPropertiesFileIfExists

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> loadPropertiesFileIfExists(java.lang.String fileName)
                                                                                   throws java.io.IOException
Loads a properties file into a map if, returning a immutable view, if the file exists. Returns an empty map otherwise.

Parameters:
fileName - file to parse
Returns:
ImmutableMap of properties found in the file if the file exists, or an empty map otherwise
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem reading the file
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file was malformed and could not be parsed

loadPropertiesFileIfExists

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> loadPropertiesFileIfExists(java.io.File file)
                                                                                   throws java.io.IOException
Loads a properties file into a map if, returning a immutable view, if the file exists. Returns an empty map otherwise.

Parameters:
file - file to parse
Returns:
ImmutableMap of properties found in the file if the file exists, or an empty map otherwise
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem reading the file
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file was malformed and could not be parsed

loadPropertiesStream

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> loadPropertiesStream(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
                                                                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Loads an input stream containing key=value pairs into a map, returning a immutable view. The parameter is typically an InputStream over a properties file.

Parameters:
inputStream - stream to parse
Returns:
ImmutableMap of properties found in the stream
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem reading from the stream
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the stream was malformed and could not be parsed
See Also:
loadPropertiesFile(String)

emptyPropertiesMap

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> emptyPropertiesMap()
Returns an empty map, typed for ease of use.
